translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽. The Chatta Vagga
The Story of the Elder Pallaṅkadāyaka
“To Sumedha, the Fortunate One,🔽the chief in the world, the one who is patient,
with a pillow and a coverlet.
That seat was endowed with the seven treasures,
and at that time it was
I gave a seat at that time;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of the seat.
three people had a golden complexion;
I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the elder Pallaṅkadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā pallaṅkadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Pallaṅkadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā pallaṅkadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati  pallaṅkadāyaka therassa apadānam dasama
translated: The Story of the Elder Pallaṅkadāyaka is the tenth.

original: Anulepo ca maggo ca,🔽phalako ca vaṭaṁsako;
analyzed: anulepaḥ ca maggo ca 🔽phalako ca vaṭasako

translated: The one who gave a seat, and the verses,
